channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: From Venezuela to Ukraine, Trump is shaking up American diplomacy around the world
item.description: On this week's episode of Sources & Methods, NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks to correspondents Greg Myre and Eleanor Beardsley about the future of the U.S. alliance with Europe under President Trump.
item.content:encoded: On this week's episode of Sources & Methods, NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks to correspondents Greg Myre and Eleanor Beardsley about the future of the U.S. alliance with Europe under President Trump.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: U.S. and Japan flex military muscles in a show of force amid Tokyo's feud with Beijing
item.description: This follows joint drills by Chinese and Russian strategic bombers and fighters on Tuesday that prompted Japan and South Korea to scramble planes to monitor them.
item.content:encoded:
This follows joint drills by Chinese and Russian strategic bombers and fighters on Tuesday that prompted Japan and South Korea to scramble planes to monitor them.

(Image credit: Japan's Ministry of Defense)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Senate to vote on 2 health care proposals. And, the latest U.S. move against Venezuela
item.description: The Senate is expected to vote on two opposing health care proposals today. And, the Trump administration says it has seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela in its latest move in the region.
item.content:encoded:
The Senate is expected to vote on two opposing health care proposals today. And, the Trump administration says it has seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela in its latest move in the region.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Trump administration says the U.S. seized an oil tanker off the Venezuelan coast
item.description: The Trump administration says it seized an oil tanker off the Venezuelan coast, as Congress presses for answers about U.S. strikes on alleged drug boats and the admiral overseeing the strikes retires.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration says it seized an oil tanker off the Venezuelan coast, as Congress presses for answers about U.S. strikes on alleged drug boats and the admiral overseeing the strikes retires.
item.dc:creator: Steve Walsh

item.title: Veteran diplomat weighs the meaning of the U.S. seizure of a Venezuelan oil tanker
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Richard Haass, president emeritus of the Council on Foreign Relations, about the U.S. seizing an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks to Richard Haass, president emeritus of the Council on Foreign Relations, about the U.S. seizing an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Venezuelan opposition leader Machado reappears in Oslo as a Nobel laureate
item.description: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado appeared in public for the first time in 11 months after a daring escape from her homeland when she emerged from a hotel balcony in Norway's capital.
item.content:encoded:
Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado appeared in public for the first time in 11 months after a daring escape from her homeland when she emerged from a hotel balcony in Norway's capital.

(Image credit: Jonas Been Henriksen)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says the U.S. has seized an oil tanker off the coast of Venezuela
item.description: Using U.S. forces to take control of a merchant ship is unusual and marks the Trump administration's latest push to increase pressure on Maduro, who has been charged with narcoterrorism.
item.content:encoded:
Using U.S. forces to take control of a merchant ship is unusual and marks the Trump administration's latest push to increase pressure on Maduro, who has been charged with narcoterrorism.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: María Corina Machado's daughter accepts her mother's Nobel Peace Prize
item.description: María Corina Machado's daughter accepted her mother's Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo, vowing the embattled Venezuelan opposition leader "will never give up" on a free Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: María Corina Machado's daughter accepted her mother's Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo, vowing the embattled Venezuelan opposition leader "will never give up" on a free Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Greetings from Andhra Pradesh, India, where a fragrant food stand feeds working women
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.content:encoded: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: The daughter of Venezuela's Machado accepts the Nobel Peace Prize in her absence
item.description: The Nobel committee said laureate María Corina Machado was safe and was braving the journey to Norway.
item.content:encoded:
The Nobel committee said laureate María Corina Machado was safe and was braving the journey to Norway.

(Image credit: Stian Lysberg Solum)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
